raw_cloud.description: Select cloud: 1 - azure; 2 - aws; Choose from [1, 2]

raw_cicd_platform.description: Select CICD platform: 1 - GitHub Actions; 2 - GitHub Actions for GitHub Enterprise Servers; 3 - Azure DevOpsChoose from [1, 2, 3]

raw_databricks_staging_workspace_host.description: URL of staging Databricks workspace, used to run CI tests on PRs and preview config changes before they're deployed to production. Azure - https://adb-xxxx.xx.azuredatabricks.net; AWS - https://your-staging-workspace.cloud.databricks.com

raw_databricks_prod_workspace_host.description: URL of production Databricks workspace. Azure - https://adb-xxxx.xx.azuredatabricks.net; AWS - https://your-staging-workspace.cloud.databricks.com

default_branch.description: Name of the default branch, where the prod and staging ML resources are deployed from and the latest ML code is staged

release_branch.description: Name of the release branch. The production jobs (model training, batch inference) defined in this stack pull ML code from this branch

read_user_group.description: User group name to give READ permissions to for project resources (ML jobs, integration test job runs, and machine learning resources). A group with this name must exist in both the staging and prod workspaces

raw_include_feature_store.description: Whether to include feature store: 1 - no; 2 - yes; Choose from [1, 2]

raw_include_mlflow_recipes.description: Whether to include mlflow recipes: 1 - no; 2 - yes; Choose from [1, 2]
